se.kth.akok.index.algorithms.shadowpoint

Class ShadowPointsAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.kth.akok.index.algorithms.shadowpoint.ShadowPointsAlgorithm

  • public class ShadowPointsAlgorithm
extends Object
    ShadowPointsAlgorithm calculates the shadow points and corresponding shadow rays of a given polygon point in the scene.
    Author:
    Andreas Kokkalis

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShadowPointsAlgorithm

        public ShadowPointsAlgorithm(Boundary boundary,
                     ArrayList<BasicPolygon> polygons)
        Parameters:
        boundary - The boundary contains the 4 line segments of the bounding box, and the 4 coordinates.
        polygons - The polygons of the scene.

    • Method Detail

      • setShadowPointsOf

        public void setShadowPointsOf(PolygonPoint startPoint)
        For each visible point, it extends the ray to the boundary. Then defines a shadowPoint as the closest point intersection of the ray with any of the geometries that are not startPoint or endPoint polygon.
        Parameters:
        startPoint - The point for which shadow points are calculated.
        polygons - The polygons in the scene.

      • computeShadowPointForSegment

        private void computeShadowPointForSegment(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.LineSegment extendedSegment,
                                PolygonPoint startPoint,
                                PolygonPoint endPoint,
                                com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Geometry endPointPolygon)
        Computes the shadow points and the shadow rays if exists for a given startPoint and a given endPoint.

        For each visible point, it extends the ray to the boundary. Then defines a shadowPoint as the closest point intersection of the ray with any of the geometries that are not startPoint or endPoint polygon.

        Parameters:
        extendedSegment - The extended to boundary segment from startPoint to endPoint
        startPoint - The point for which shadow points are calculated.
        endPoint - The visible point
        endPointPolygon -

      • setClosestShadowPoint

        private void setClosestShadowPoint(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.LineString extendedString,
                         PolygonPoint startPoint,
                         PolygonPoint endPoint)
        The extended segment intersects some geometries. Depending on the type of intersection, it gathers the intersection points and considers them as possible shadow points. It chooses as shadow point the closest point to start point.
        Parameters:
        extendedString - The extended visible segment.
        startPoint - The start point of the segment.
        endPoint - The end point of the segment.

      • updateIncomingShadowPoint

        private void updateIncomingShadowPoint(ShadowPoint shadowPoint,
                             PolygonPoint startPoint,
                             PolygonPoint endPoint)
        When a shadowPoint falls on another geometry, an incoming shadowPoint may exist. This function follows the same procedure with the main algorithm, to find the incoming shadowPoint

        Creates a lineSegment from shadowPoint to startPoint. extends to boundary and finds the new shadow point. The old shadowPoint is now the new incomingPoint.

        Parameters:
        shadowPoint - This is the new incomingPoint
        startPoint - The start point that becomes the endPoint of incomingPoint
        polygons - The list of polygons

      • extendSegmentToBoundary

        private com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.LineSegment extendSegmentToBoundary(com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Point endPoint,
                                                              com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.LineSegment lineSegment)
        The function computes the equation of each line segment. Then tests for each boundary line segment if the resulting coordinate (x,y) falls into the corresponding line segment. The four boundary segments are minX, maxX, minY, maxY. An extended segments intersects at least two of these boundary segments. The extended ray that has same angle from the X axis with the initial visible ray is returned.
        Parameters:
        endPoint - The visible point from startPoint.
        lineSegment - The visible ray from startPoint to endPoint.
        Returns:
        The extended to the boundary ray.
